p: We performed parameter sensitivity analysis to examine the robustness of our model and to evaluate whether varying key parameters affected the results. As shown in Equation (3) (see Methods), r( i, t), the risk of an individual i being infected at time t is related to daily illness attack rate R( t), local temperature T( t), his or her social network degree D( i, t), and the age A( i). Parameters c r , c t , c d and c a are the coefficients of function f( R( t)), f( T( t)), f( D( i, t)), and f( A( i)), respectively. b r , b t and b d are corresponding deviations. We varied these key parameters to see if their changes can strongly impact the total infection number.
